title: Jobs to Be Done

description.short: Understand the real problems your users are trying to solve
description.medium: Jobs to Be Done (JTBD) framework helps you understand what users actually need to accomplish, not just what features they request, leading to better product decisions
description.full: Jobs to Be Done is a framework for understanding customer needs by focusing on what they're trying to accomplish rather than who they are or what they say they want. This approach helps you build products that solve real problems, avoid feature bloat, and create genuine value. Learn how to conduct JTBD interviews, identify the functional, emotional, and social dimensions of user needs, and translate insights into product decisions.

why_it_matters: Building the wrong thing perfectly is still failure
Feature requests often mask the real underlying need
Better problem understanding leads to better solutions
Reduces wasted development effort on unused features

objectives: Distinguish between jobs, solutions, and features
Recognize when to apply JTBD thinking
key_takeaways: Jobs are about progress, not products
Focus on the why behind user requests
The real job might not need your solution

objectives: Identify functional, emotional, and social dimensions
Translate JTBD insights into product requirements
key_takeaways: Prioritizing based on job importance and satisfaction

common_mistakes: Not digging deep enough in interviews
Assuming you know the job without research
when_to_prioritize: Starting a new product or feature
Low user adoption despite good execution
